metadata.title: CVE-2016-4954 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The process_packet function in ntp_proto.c in ntpd in NTP 4.x before4.2.8p8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (peer-variablemodification) by sending spoofed packets from many source IP addresses in acertain scenario, as demonstrated by triggering an incorrect leapindication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4954` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.10').
